result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber Ann Uher

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amber Ann Uher appeared by video.  Attorney Amanda M. Parent appeared by video for Amber Ann Uher.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed with prejudice.  Bail to be returned if applicable.
Received and Filed. DPA Progress Letter from Monitor
Received and Filed. DPA Progress Report

Defendant Amber Ann Uher in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amber Ann Uher appeared by video means.
Defendant is in compliance with the terms of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-15-2022
Received and Filed, DPA Progress Report
Received and Filed, DPA Progress Update

Defendant Amber Ann Uher (via Zoom) in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defendant warned regarding tardiness. Report needs to be filed. 
Defendant is attending treatment. Defendant is compliant. Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for Final Review Hearing.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:10 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No Contact with RJW unless consistance with and approved DMCPS.

Defendant Amber Ann Uher in court with Attorney Amanda M. Parent.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  The Court accepts an ORAL amendments to the Criminal Complaint the victim initials are RJW not RAW and line four of the criminal complaint to Drug distribution AMENED to Drug abuse Wis statue 46.973(1)(b).  The  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
  Return on warrant scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionaire/Wiaver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The Court reviewed the conditions with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended.



Deferred prosecution agreement received and filed
Addendum to the Plea Questionnaire received and filed
